entries.title: New heavy infantry fighting vehicle spotted in Russia

summary.#text:
A new heavy infantry fighting vehicle (IFV), believed to be based on the T-72 main battle tank platform, has been spotted in Nizhny Tagil, Russia. The brief video footage, captured near the Uralvagonzavod testing ground—home to the production of Russia’s T-72, T-90, and T-14 Armata tanks—has sparked interest and speculation among defense analysts. This tracked […]

The post New heavy infantry fighting vehicle spotted in Russia first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Italy set to finalize $21,6B combat vehicle deal with Rheinmetall

summary.#text:
Italy is on the verge of finalizing a substantial defense contract with German arms manufacturer Rheinmetall, valued at approximately €20 billion ($21,6 billion). According to the German newspaper “Handelsblatt,” the Italian government aims to procure 350 Lynx infantry fighting vehicles and over 200 Panther tanks from Rheinmetall. The contract, which is expected to span 15 […]

The post Italy set to finalize $21,6B combat vehicle deal with Rheinmetall first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Taiwan reports increased Chinese military activity

summary.#text:
The Ministry of National Defense of the Republic of China (ROC) reported on X (formerly Twitter) that it had detected 30 People’s Liberation Army (PLA) aircraft and 8 People’s Liberation Army Navy (PLAN) vessels operating around Taiwan by 6 a.m. (UTC+8) today. Of the detected aircraft, 19 crossed the median line and entered Taiwan’s northern, […]

The post Taiwan reports increased Chinese military activity first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Lockheed Martin delivers 100th torpedo guidance system to US Navy

summary.#text:
Last month, Lockheed Martin marked a significant milestone with the 100th delivery of new production Guidance and Control (G&C) sections for the U.S. Navy’s MK 48 MOD 7 heavyweight torpedoes. These critical components are essential to increasing the number of torpedoes in the Navy’s inventory, thereby enhancing the capabilities of the Submarine Force during what […]

The post Lockheed Martin delivers 100th torpedo guidance system to US Navy first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Chinese cargo plane makes suspicious landing in Moscow

summary.#text:
On Saturday, June 29, a Chinese military transport aircraft, the Y-20 with tail number 20248, made a landing in Moscow, Russia. The appearance of this aircraft, capable of transporting military cargo, raises concerns amid Russia’s ongoing war against Ukraine. Reports of the aircraft’s landing in Russia have been circulating on aviation tracking websites. However, there […]

The post Chinese cargo plane makes suspicious landing in Moscow first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Mitsubishi Electric to repair F-15 fighter jet radars

summary.#text:
Mitsubishi Electric Corporation has announced a pilot contract with Raytheon, an RTX business, to repair transmitters used in the APG-63 (V)1 radars of F-15 fighter jets operated by the U.S. Air Force (USAF) and its allied forces. Under this pilot contract, Raytheon will assess Mitsubishi Electric’s repair capabilities with the intention of establishing a long-term […]

The post Mitsubishi Electric to repair F-15 fighter jet radars first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Leonardo DRS reaches 1,000 sensor deliveries for missile warning

summary.#text:
Leonardo DRS, Inc. has announced the delivery of its 1,000th advanced sensor package, a core component of BAE Systems’ 2-Color Advanced Warning System (2CAWS). As noted by the company, this next-generation missile warning and hostile fire detection system is designed to protect U.S. Army pilots and crews from emerging missile threats. The advanced DRS 2-color […]

The post Leonardo DRS reaches 1,000 sensor deliveries for missile warning first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Belarus unveils Iranian-designed drones in military parade

summary.#text:
Iranian-designed Shahed-136 drones, known as Geran-2 in Russia, were showcased in Belarusian service for the first time during a military parade in Minsk, the capital of Belarus. The drones, which appear to have been designated as Kochevnik (Nomad) by Belarus, were prominently displayed on Chinese GWM King Kong Cannon pickup trucks serving as launch platforms. […]

The post Belarus unveils Iranian-designed drones in military parade first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Ukrainian Air Force showcases HAWK missile system

summary.#text:
The Ukrainian Air Force has unveiled the U.S.-supplied HAWK surface-to-air missile system, which has been effectively used to counter Russian suicide drones and cruise missiles. This system has reportedly downed over two dozen Iranian-designed Shahed drones and four missiles targeting Ukrainian civilian infrastructure. The HAWK, an acronym for Homing All the Way Killer, has undergone […]

The post Ukrainian Air Force showcases HAWK missile system first appeared on Defence Blog.

entries.title: Czechia launches suicide drone production for Ukraine

summary.#text:
The Czech-Ukrainian company UAC has commenced the manufacturing of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) in Czechia, specifically for the Ukrainian army. The company, which employs approximately 80 people, primarily Ukrainians, produces various types of drones, including the Leleka-LR (Stork-LR) reconnaissance drone and the Mace loitering munition. “In November, we started trial operation, and in April, we […]

The post Czechia launches suicide drone production for Ukraine first appeared on Defence Blog.
